The Senate votes to avert a shutdown after Schumer relents.  —  Where Things Stand  — Shutdown averted: The Senate on Friday narrowly averted a government shutdown at midnight, passing in a 54-46, nearly party-line vote a G.O.P.-written stopgap spending measure that funds the government through Sept. 30.
